 - Password: `password`

2. **The app should detect you're an admin** and potentially show admin-specific features (though the UI might need to be enhanced to show admin options)

### Option 2: Access Admin Dashboard via Web Browser (Recommended)

Since the backend has comprehensive admin APIs, you can access the admin dashboard directly via web browser or API testing tools:

**Admin Dashboard API Endpoints:**
- **Dashboard Stats**: `http://localhost:8080/api/admin/dashboard`
- **All Users**: `http://localhost:8080/api/admin/users`
- **All Orders**: `http://localhost:8080/api/admin/orders`
- **All Pickups**: `http://localhost:8080/api/admin/pickups`
- **Revenue Stats**: `http://localhost:8080/api/admin/revenue`

 49	 public JwtResponse getUserSession() {
 50	 if (!isLoggedIn()) {
 51	 return null;
 52	 }
 53	 
 54	 JwtResponse user = new JwtResponse();
 55	 user.setToken(pref.getString(KEY_TOKEN, null));
 56	 user.setId(pref.getLong(KEY_USER_ID, 0));
 57	 user.setEmail(pref.getString(KEY_EMAIL, null));
 58	 user.setFirstName(pref.getString(KEY_FIRST_NAME, null));
 59	 user.setLastName(pref.getString(KEY_LAST_NAME, null));
 60	 user.setPhoneNumber(pref.getString(KEY_PHONE, null));
 61	 user.setRole(pref.getString(KEY_ROLE, null));
 62	 user.setPointsBalance(pref.getInt(KEY_POINTS, 0));
 63	 user.setTotalOrders(pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, 0));
 64	 user.setTotalPickups(pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, 0));
 65	 user.setRecyclingPercentage((double) pref.getFloat(KEY_RECYCLING_PERCENTAGE, 0.0f));
 66	 
 67	 return user;
 68	 }

\n .section {\n margin-bottom: 30px;\n }\n \n .section h2 {\n color: #333;\n margin-bottom: 20px;\n padding-bottom: 10px;\n border-bottom: 2px solid #4CAF50;\n }\n \n .error {\n color: #f44336;\n margin-top: 10px;\n }\n \n .success {\n color: #4CAF50;\n margin-top: 10px;\n }\n \n .loading {\n text-align: center;\n color: #666;\n font-style: italic;\n }\n </style>\n</head>\n<body>\n <div class=\"container\">\n <div class=\"header\">\n <h1>\ud83c\udf31 WasteReborn Admin Dashboard</h1>\n <p>Manage your waste management platform</p>\n </div>\n \n <div id=\"loginSection\" class=\"login-section\">\n <h2>Admin Login</h2>\n <div class=\"login-form\">\n <div class=\"form-group\">\n <label for=\"email\">Email:</label>\n <input type=\"email\" id=\"email\" value=\"admin@wastereborn.com\" required>\n </div>\n <div class=\"form-group\">\n <label for=\"password\">Password:</label>\n <input type=\"password\" id=\"password\" value=\"password\" required>\n </div>\n <button class=\"btn\" onclick=\"login()\">Login</button>\n <div id=\"loginMessage\"></div>\n </div>\n </div>\n \n <div id=\"dashboard\" class=\"dashboard\">\n <div class=\"section\">\n <h2>\ud83d\udcca Dashboard Overview</h2>\n <div id=\"statsGrid\" class=\"stats-grid\">\n <div class=\"loading\">Loading dashboard statistics...</div>\n </div>\n </div>\n </div>\n </div>\n\n <script>\n const API_BASE = 'http://localhost:8080/api';\n let authToken = '';\n\n async function login() {\n const email = document.getElementById('email').value;\n const password = document.getElementById('password').value;\n const messageDiv = document.getElementById('loginMessage');\n \n try {\n const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}/auth/login`, {\n method: 'POST',\n headers: {\n 'Content-Type': 'application/json',\n },\n body: JSON.stringify({ email, password })\n });\n \n if (response.ok) {\n const data = await response.json();\n if (data.role === 'ADMIN') {\n authToken = data.token;\n messageDiv.innerHTML = '<div class=\"success\">Login successful! Loading dashboard...</div>';\n document.getElementById('loginSection').style.display = 'none';\n document.getElementById('dashboard').style.display = 'block';\n loadDashboard();\n } else {\n messageDiv.innerHTML = '<div class=\"error\">Access denied. Admin privileges required.</div>';\n }\n } else {\n messageDiv.innerHTML = '<div class=\"error\">Invalid credentials. Please try again.</div>';\n }\n } catch (error) {\n messageDiv.innerHTML = '<div class=\"error\">Connection error. Make sure the backend is running.</div>';\n console.error('Login error:', error);\n }\n }\n\n async function loadDashboard() {\n try {\n const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}/admin/dashboard`, {\n headers: {\n 'Authorization': `Bearer ${authToken}`\n }\n });\n \n if (response.ok) {\n const stats = await response.json();\n displayStats(stats);\n } else {\n document.getElementById('statsGrid').innerHTML = '<div class=\"error\">Failed to load dashboard data.</div>';\n }\n } catch (error) {\n document.getElementById('statsGrid').innerHTML = '<div class=\"error\">Error loading dashboard data.</div>';\n console.error('Dashboard error:', error);\n }\n }\n\n function displayStats(stats) {\n const statsGrid = document.getElementById('statsGrid');\n statsGrid.innerHTML = `\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.totalUsers}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Total Users</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.regularUsers}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Regular Users</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.adminUsers}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Admin Users</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.totalOrders}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Total Orders</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.pendingOrders}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Pending Orders</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.completedOrders}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Completed Orders</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.totalPickups}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Total Pickups</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.pendingPickups}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Pending Pickups</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.totalProducts}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Total Products</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">$${stats.totalRevenue.toFixed(2)}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Total Revenue</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">$${stats.weeklyRevenue.toFixed(2)}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Weekly Revenue</div>\n </div>\n <div class=\"stat-card\">\n <div class=\"stat-number\">${stats.weeklyOrders}</div>\n <div class=\"stat-label\">Weekly Orders</div>\n </div>\n `;\n }\n\n // Allow Enter key to login\n document.addEventListener('keypress', function(e) {\n if (e.key === 'Enter' && document.getElementById('loginSection').style.display !== 'none') {\n login();\n }\n });\n </script>\n</body>\n</html>"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Perfect! ## How to Access the Admin Dashboard:

### Method 1: Web Admin Dashboard (Recommended)

1. **Open the admin dashboard** in your web browser:
 ```
 file:///Users/delphinemofor/AndroidStudioProjects/WasteReborn/admin-dashboard.html
 ```
 
 Or simply double-click the `admin-dashboard.html` file in your project folder.

2. **Login with admin credentials:**
 - Email: `admin@wastereborn.com`
 - Password: `password`

3. **View comprehensive admin statistics:**
 - Total users, orders, pickups
 - Revenue tracking
 - Pending vs completed items
 - Real-time data from your backend

### Method 2: Android App Admin Login

1. **Login to the Android app** with admin credentials:
 - Email: `admin@wastereborn.com`
 - Password: `password`

2. The app will recognize you as an admin (though the UI might not show admin-specific features yet)

### Method 3: Direct API Access

You can also access admin data directly via API calls:

```bash
# Get admin dashboard stats
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" http://localhost:8080/api/admin/dashboard

# Get all users
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" http://localhost:8080/api/admin/users

# Get revenue stats
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" http://localhost:8080/api/admin/revenue
```

## Admin Dashboard Features:

✅ **Real-time Statistics Dashboard**
- User management (total, regular, admin users)
- Order analytics (total, pending, completed)
- Pickup management (total, pending, completed)
- Revenue tracking (total, weekly)
- Product inventory

✅ **Beautiful UI**
- Green/blue color scheme matching your app
- Responsive design
- Hover effects and animations
- Clean, professional layout

✅ **Secure Authentication**
- Admin-only access
- JWT token-based authentication
- Error handling for invalid credentials

The web dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of your WasteReborn platform's performance and is perfect for administrative tasks. Try opening it in your browser and logging in with the admin credentials!

 97	
 98	### Backend (Spring Boot)
 99	```
 100	├── Controllers (Auth, Product, Pickup, Admin, etc.)
 101	├── Services (User, Product, Pickup, etc.)
 102	├── Models/Entities (User, Product, Order, PickupRequest)
 103	├── Repositories (JPA repositories)
 104	├── Security (JWT, Authentication filters)
 105	└── Configuration (Database, Security, CORS)
 106	```
 107	
 108	## Getting Started
 109	
 110	### Quick Setup
 111	1. **Clone Repository** - `git clone <repo-url>`
 112	2. **Setup Database** - Run PostgreSQL and create database
 113	3. **Start Backend** - `./run-backend.sh` or manual Maven setup
 114	4. **Open Android Studio** - Import project and run on device/emulator
 115	
 116	### Default Accounts
 117	- **Admin**: admin@wastereborn.com / password
 118	- **User**: john@example.com / password
 119	
 120	## Future Enhancements

Path: PROJECT_SUMMARY.md
...
 51	
 52	### ️ Database Schema
 53	- **Users** - User accounts with roles and statistics
 54	- **Products** - Recycled products catalog with categories
 55	- **Orders & Order Items** - Complete order management
 56	- **Pickup Requests** - Waste pickup scheduling and tracking
 57	- **Points System** - Reward tracking and redemption
 58	
 59	## Design & User Experience
 60	
 61	### Color Scheme
 62	- **Primary Green** (#4CAF50, #2E7D32) - Logo, main buttons, success states
 63	- **Sky Blue** (#87CEEB) - Accent highlights and secondary actions
 64	- **Clean Layout** - Black text on white background for readability
...
 97	
 98	### Backend (Spring Boot)
 99	```
 100	├── Controllers (Auth, Product, Pickup, Admin, etc.)
 101	├── Services (User, Product, Pickup, etc.)
 102	├── Models/Entities (User, Product, Order, PickupRequest)
 103	├── Repositories (JPA repositories)
 104	├── Security (JWT, Authentication filters)
 105	└── Configuration (Database, Security, CORS)
 106	```
 107	
 108	## Getting Started
 109	
 110	### Quick Setup
 111	1. **Clone Repository** - `git clone <repo-url>`
 112	2. **Setup Database** - Run PostgreSQL and create database
 113	3. **Start Backend** - `./run-backend.sh` or manual Maven setup
 114	4. **Open Android Studio** - Import project and run on device/emulator
 115	
 116	### Default Accounts
 117	- **Admin**: admin@wastereborn.com / password
 118	- **User**: john@example.com / password
 119	
 120	## Future Enhancements

 62	 public Integer getPointsUsed() { return pointsUsed; }

Path: PROJECT_SUMMARY.md
...
 79	
 80	### Admin Analytics
 81	- **User Management** - Total users, active users, top recyclers
 82	- **Revenue Tracking** - Total, monthly, weekly, daily revenue
 83	- **Order Analytics** - Pending, completed, cancelled orders
 84	- **Pickup Management** - Scheduled, completed, pending pickups
 85	
 86	## Technical Architecture
 87	
 88	### Frontend (Android)
 89	```
 90	├── Activities (Main, Auth, Dashboard, Welcome)
 91	├── Fragments (Home, Marketplace, Cart, Pickup, Rewards, etc.)
 92	├── API Layer (Retrofit, ApiClient, ApiService)
 93	├── Models (User, Product, Order, etc.)
 94	├── Utils (SessionManager, CartManager)
 95	└── Resources (Layouts, Drawables, Strings)
 96	```

 10	public class AuthActivity extends AppCompatActivity {
 11	
 12	 TabLayout tabLayout;
 13	 ViewPager2 viewPager;
 14	 AuthPagerAdapter pagerAdapter;
 15	
 16	 @Override
 17	 protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
 18	 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
 19	 setContentView(R.layout.activity_auth);
 20	
 21	 tabLayout = findViewById(R.id.tab_layout);
 22	 viewPager = findViewById(R.id.view_pager);
 23	
 24	 pagerAdapter = new AuthPagerAdapter(this);
 25	 viewPager.setAdapter(pagerAdapter);
 26	
 27	 new TabLayoutMediator(tabLayout, viewPager,
 28	 (tab, position) -> {
 29	 if (position == 0) tab.setText("Login");
 30	 else tab.setText("Sign Up");
 31	 }).attach();
 32	
 33	 // Get selected tab from intent
 34	 int selectedTab = getIntent().getIntExtra("selectedTab", 0);
 35	 viewPager.setCurrentItem(selectedTab, false);
 36	 }
 37	
 38	}

...
 6	
 7	### User Features
 8	- **User Authentication** - Secure login and registration
 9	- ️ **Waste Pickup Booking** - Schedule waste collection based on street routes
 10	- **Recycled Products Marketplace** - Browse and purchase eco-friendly products
 11	- **Points Reward System** - Earn 5 points per successful pickup
 12	- **Order Tracking** - Track marketplace orders and pickup requests
 13	- **Personal Dashboard** - View recycling stats and order history
 14	- **Search & Filter** - Find products by category or keywords
 15	- **Chat Bot** - Get help and support
 16	- **Mobile Money Integration** - Pay using Orange Money/Mobile Money
 17	- **Progress Tracking** - Monitor recycling percentage and achievements
...
 35	
 36	### Android App
 37	- **Java** - Programming language
 38	- **Retrofit 2** - HTTP client
 39	- **Material Design** - UI components
 40	- **Glide** - Image loading
 41	- **SharedPreferences** - Local storage
 42	
 43	## Color Scheme
 44	- **Primary Green** (#2e7d32) - Logo and main buttons
 45	- **Sky Blue** (#87CEEB) - Accent highlights
 46	- **Black on White** - Text and background
 47	
 48	## Setup Instructions
 49	
 50	### Prerequisites
 51	- Java 17 or higher
 52	- PostgreSQL 12 or higher
 53	- Android Studio
 54	- Maven 3.6 or higher
 55	
 56	### Backend Setup
 57	
 58	1. **Clone the repository**
 59	 ```bash
 60	 git clone <repository-url>
 61	 cd WasteReborn
 62	 ```

 129	### Key Tables
 130	- **users** - User accounts and profiles
 131	- **products** - Recycled products catalog
 132	- **orders** - Marketplace orders
 133	- **order_items** - Order line items
 134	- **pickup_requests** - Waste pickup bookings
 135	- **notifications** - System notifications
 136	- **reviews** - User feedback
 137	
 138	## Development Roadmap

 141	- Basic authentication system
 142	- Product marketplace
 143	- User dashboard
 144	- Backend API foundation

 149	- Order tracking
 150	- Admin panel
 151	
 152	### Phase 3 (Planned)
 153	- Mobile money integration
 154	- Push notifications
 155	- Chat bot implementation
 156	- Advanced analytics
 157	- Review system

 16	 setContentView(R.layout.activity_welcome);
 17	
 18	 btnLogin = findViewById(R.id.btn_login);
 19	 btnSignup = findViewById(R.id.btn_signup);
 20	
 21	 btnLogin.setOnClickListener(v -> {
 22	 Intent i = new Intent(WelcomeActivity.this, AuthActivity.class);
 23	 i.putExtra("selectedTab", 0); // Show login tab
 24	 startActivity(i);
 25	 });
 26	
 27	 btnSignup.setOnClickListener(v -> {
 28	 Intent i = new Intent(WelcomeActivity.this, AuthActivity.class);
 29	 i.putExtra("selectedTab", 1); // Show signup tab
 30	 startActivity(i);
 31	 });
 32	 }

Path: app/src/main/java/com/example/wastereborn/fragments/HomeFragment.java
 1	package com.example.wastereborn.fragments;
 2	
 3	
 4	import android.os.Bundle;
 5	import android.os.Handler;
 6	import android.view.LayoutInflater;
 7	import android.view.View;
 8	import android.view.ViewGroup;
 9	import android.widget.TextView;
 10	
 11	import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
 12	import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
 13	import androidx.cardview.widget.CardView;
 14	import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
 15	
 16	import com.example.wastereborn.R;
 17	import com.example.wastereborn.utils.SessionManager;
 18	
 19	public class HomeFragment extends Fragment {
 20	
 21	 private TextView greetingText, userInitial, percentageRecycled, totalOrders;
 22	 private CardView cardOrderPickup, cardVisitStore;
 23	 private SessionManager sessionManager;
 24	
 25	 @Nullable
 26	 @Override
 27	 public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater,
 28	 @Nullable ViewGroup container,
 29	 @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
 30	
 31	 View view = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_home, container, false);
 32	
 33	 // Initialize session manager
 34	 sessionManager = new SessionManager(requireContext());
 35	
 36	 // Initialize views
 37	 greetingText = view.findViewById(R.id.greeting_text);
 38	 userInitial = view.findViewById(R.id.user_initial);
 39	 percentageRecycled = view.findViewById(R.id.percent_recycled);
 40	 totalOrders = view.findViewById(R.id.total_orders);
 41	 cardOrderPickup = view.findViewById(R.id.card_order_pickup);
 42	 cardVisitStore = view.findViewById(R.id.card_visit_store);
 43	
 44	 // Set greeting timeout (hide after 20 seconds)
 45	 new Handler().postDelayed(() -> greetingText.setVisibility(View.GONE), 20000);
 46	
 47	 // Load real user data from session
 48	 loadUserData();
 49	
 50	 // Set card click actions
 51	 cardOrderPickup.setOnClickListener(v -> {
 52	 // Navigate to PickupFragment
 53	 getParentFragmentManager().beginTransaction()
 54	 .replace(R.id.fragment_container, new PickupFragment())
 55	 .addToBackStack(null)
 56	 .commit();
 57	 });
 58	
 59	 cardVisitStore.setOnClickListener(v -> {
 60	 // Navigate to MarketPlaceFragment
 61	 getParentFragmentManager().beginTransaction()
 62	 .replace(R.id.fragment_container, new MarketPlaceFragment())
 63	 .addToBackStack(null)
 64	 .commit();
 65	 });
 66	
 67	 return view;
 68	 }
 69	
 70	 private void loadUserData() {
 71	 if (sessionManager.isLoggedIn()) {
 72	 // Set user initial
 73	 userInitial.setText(sessionManager.getUserInitial());
 74	
 75	 // Set user stats from session
 76	 double recyclingPercentage = sessionManager.getRecyclingPercentage();
 77	 int totalOrdersCount = sessionManager.getTotalOrders();
 78	
 79	 percentageRecycled.setText((int)recyclingPercentage + "% Recycled");
 80	 totalOrders.setText(totalOrdersCount + " Orders");
 81	
 82	 // Set greeting with user name
 83	 String greeting = "Hello, " + sessionManager.getUserName().split(" ")[0] + "!";
 84	 greetingText.setText(greeting);
 85	 } else {
 86	 // Default values if not logged in
 87	 userInitial.setText("U");
 88	 percentageRecycled.setText("0% Recycled");
 89	 totalOrders.setText("0 Orders");
 90	 greetingText.setText("Welcome to WasteReborn!");
 91	 }
 92	 }
 93	}
 94

 1	#!/bin/bash
 2	
 3	# WasteReborn Backend Startup Script
 4	
 5	echo " Starting WasteReborn Backend..."
 6	
 7	# Check if PostgreSQL is running
 8	if ! pgrep -x "postgres" > /dev/null; then
 9	 echo "❌ PostgreSQL is not running. Please start PostgreSQL first."
 10	 echo " On macOS: brew services start postgresql"
 11	 echo " On Ubuntu: sudo service postgresql start"
 12	 echo " On Windows: Start PostgreSQL service"
 13	 exit 1
 14	fi
 15	
 16	# Check if database exists
 17	DB_EXISTS=$(psql -U postgres -lqt | cut -d \| -f 1 | grep -qw wastereborn_db; echo $?)
 18	
 19	if [ $DB_EXISTS -ne 0 ]; then
 20	 echo " Creating database..."
 21	 psql -U postgres -c "CREATE DATABASE wastereborn_db;"
 22	 psql -U postgres -c "CREATE USER wastereborn_user WITH PASSWORD 'wastereborn_pass';"
 23	 psql -U postgres -c "GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE wastereborn_db TO wastereborn_user;"
 24	 echo "✅ Database created successfully!"
 25	else
 26	 echo "✅ Database already exists"
 27	fi
 28	
 29	# Navigate to backend directory
 30	cd backend
 31	
 32	# Check if Maven is installed
 33	if ! command -v mvn &> /dev/null; then
 34	 echo "❌ Maven is not installed. Please install Maven first."
 35	 echo " Visit: https://maven.apache.org/install.html"
 36	 exit 1
 37	fi
 38	
 39	echo " Installing dependencies..."
 40	mvn clean install -DskipTests
 41	
 42	echo " Starting Spring Boot application..."
 43	mvn spring-boot:run
 44	
 45	echo " WasteReborn Backend is now running on http://localhost:8080/api"
 46	echo " API Documentation will be available at http://localhost:8080/api/swagger-ui.html"
 47

 40	 return userRepository.save(user);

 82	 @GetMapping("/validate")
 83	 public ResponseEntity<?> validateToken(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token) {
 84	 try {
 85	 if (token.startsWith("Bearer ")) {
 86	 token = token.substring(7);
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 if (tokenProvider.validateToken(token)) {
 90	 String email = tokenProvider.getEmailFromToken(token);
 91	 User user = userService.findByEmail(email)
 92	 .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("User not found"));
 93

 95	 } else {

 1	package com.wastereborn.security;
 2	
 3	import io.jsonwebtoken.*;
 4	import io.jsonwebtoken.security.Keys;
 5	import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Value;
 6	import org.springframework.security.core.Authentication;
 7	import org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails;
 8	import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
 9	
 10	import javax.crypto.SecretKey;
 11	import java.util.Date;
 12	
 13	@Component
 14	public class JwtTokenProvider {
 15	
 16	 @Value("${spring.security.jwt.secret-key}")
 17	 private String jwtSecret;
 18	
 19	 @Value("${spring.security.jwt.expiration}")
 20	 private int jwtExpirationInMs;
 21	
 22	 private SecretKey getSigningKey() {
 23	 return Keys.hmacShaKeyFor(jwtSecret.getBytes());
 24	 }
 25	
 26	 public String generateToken(Authentication authentication) {
 27	 UserDetails userPrincipal = (UserDetails) authentication.getPrincipal();
 28	
 29	 Date expiryDate = new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() + jwtExpirationInMs);
 30	
 31	 return Jwts.builder()
 32	 .setSubject(userPrincipal.getUsername())
 33	 .setIssuedAt(new Date())
 34	 .setExpiration(expiryDate)
 35	 .signWith(getSigningKey(), SignatureAlgorithm.HS512)
 36	 .compact();
 37	 }
 38	
 39	 public String generateTokenFromEmail(String email) {
 40	 Date expiryDate = new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() + jwtExpirationInMs);
 41	
 42	 return Jwts.builder()
 43	 .setSubject(email)
 44	 .setIssuedAt(new Date())
 45	 .setExpiration(expiryDate)
 46	 .signWith(getSigningKey(), SignatureAlgorithm.HS512)
 47	 .compact();
 48	 }
 49	
 50	 public String getEmailFromToken(String token) {
 51	 Claims claims = Jwts.parserBuilder()
 52	 .setSigningKey(getSigningKey())
 53	 .build()
 54	 .parseClaimsJws(token)
 55	 .getBody();
 56	
 57	 return claims.getSubject();
 58	 }
 59	
 60	 public boolean validateToken(String authToken) {
 61	 try {
 62	 Jwts.parserBuilder()
 63	 .setSigningKey(getSigningKey())
 64	 .build()
 65	 .parseClaimsJws(authToken);
 66	 return true;
 67	 } catch (SecurityException ex) {
 68	 System.err.println("Invalid JWT signature");
 69	 } catch (MalformedJwtException ex) {
 70	 System.err.println("Invalid JWT token");
 71	 } catch (ExpiredJwtException ex) {
 72	 System.err.println("Expired JWT token");
 73	 } catch (UnsupportedJwtException ex) {
 74	 System.err.println("Unsupported JWT token");
 75	 } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
 76	 System.err.println("JWT claims string is empty");
 77	 }
 78	 return false;
 79	 }
 80	}

 1	package com.example.wastereborn.api;
 2	
 3	import okhttp3.OkHttpClient;
 4	import okhttp3.logging.HttpLoggingInterceptor;
 5	import retrofit2.Retrofit;
 6	import retrofit2.converter.gson.GsonConverterFactory;
 7	
 8	import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
 9	
 10	public class ApiClient {
 11	 
 12	 private static final String BASE_URL = "http://10.0.2.2:8080/api/"; // For Android emulator
 13	 // Use "http://your-actual-ip:8080/api/" for physical device
 14	 
 15	 private static Retrofit retrofit = null;
 16	 private static ApiService apiService = null;
 17	 
 18	 public static ApiService getApiService() {
 19	 if (apiService == null) {
 20	 apiService = getRetrofitInstance().create(ApiService.class);
 21	 }
 22	 return apiService;
 23	 }
 24	 
 25	 private static Retrofit getRetrofitInstance() {
 26	 if (retrofit == null) {
 27	 // Create logging interceptor
 28	 HttpLoggingInterceptor loggingInterceptor = new HttpLoggingInterceptor();
 29	 loggingInterceptor.setLevel(HttpLoggingInterceptor.Level.BODY);
 30	 
 31	 // Create OkHttp client
 32	 OkHttpClient okHttpClient = new OkHttpClient.Builder()
 33	 .addInterceptor(loggingInterceptor)
 34	 .connectTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
 35	 .readTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
 36	 .writeTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
 37	 .build();
 38	 
 39	 retrofit = new Retrofit.Builder()
 40	 .baseUrl(BASE_URL)
 41	 .client(okHttpClient)
 42	 .addConverterFactory(GsonConverterFactory.create())
 43	 .build();
 44	 }
 45	 return retrofit;
 46	 }
 47	 
 48	 public static void resetApiService() {
 49	 apiService = null;
 50	 retrofit = null;
 51	 }
 52	}

 57	
 58	The backend will start on `http://localhost:8080/api`
 59	
 60	### 4. Android App Setup
 61	
 62	1. **Open Android Studio**
 63	2. **Open Project** → Navigate to the WasteReborn folder
 64	3. **Wait for Gradle sync** to complete
 65	4. **Update API URL** in `app/src/main/java/com/example/wastereborn/api/ApiClient.java`:
 66	 - For emulator: `http://10.0.2.2:8080/api/`
 67	 - For physical device: `http://YOUR_COMPUTER_IP:8080/api/`
 68	5. **Run the app** on your device/emulator
 69	
 70	## Configuration
 71	
 72	### Backend Configuration
 73	Edit `backend/src/main/resources/application.yml`:
 74	
 75	```yaml
 76	spring:
 77	 datasource:
 78	 url: jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/wastereborn_db
 79	 username: wastereborn_user
 80	 password: wastereborn_pass
 81	```
 82	
 83	### Android Configuration
 84	Edit `app/src/main/java/com/example/wastereborn/api/ApiClient.java`:
 85	
 86	```java
 87	private static final String BASE_URL = "http://YOUR_IP:8080/api/";
 88	```
 89	
 90	## Default Accounts
 91	
 92	### Admin Account
 93	- **Email**: admin@wastereborn.com
 94	- **Password**: password
 95	- **Role**: Admin
 96	
 97	### Test User Account
 98	- **Email**: john@example.com
 99	- **Password**: password
 100	- **Role**: User
 101	
 102	## API Endpoints
 103	
 104	### Authentication
 105	- `POST /api/auth/login` - User login
 106	- `POST /api/auth/signup` - User registration
 107	
 108	### Products
 109	- `GET /api/products/public/all` - Get all products
 110	- `GET /api/products/public/categories` - Get categories
 111	- `GET /api/products/public/search?keyword=` - Search products
...
 141	
 142	### ✅ Technical Features
 143	- JWT authentication
 144	- RESTful API
 145	- PostgreSQL database
 146	- Material Design UI
 147	- Offline data caching
 148	- Error handling
 149	
 150	## Troubleshooting
 151	
 152	### Common Issues
 153	
 154	#### Backend Won't Start
 155	```bash
 156	# Check if PostgreSQL is running
 157	ps aux | grep postgres
 158	
 159	# Check if port 8080 is available
 160	lsof -i :8080
 161	
 162	# Check Java version
 163	java -version
 164	```
 165	
 166	#### Android App Can't Connect
 167	1. Check if backend is running: `curl http://localhost:8080/api/products/public/all`
 168	2. Update API URL in ApiClient.java
 169	3. Check device/emulator network connectivity
 170	4. Disable firewall temporarily for testing
 171	
 172	#### Database Connection Issues
 173	```bash
 174	# Test database connection
 175	psql -h localhost -U wastereborn_user -d wastereborn_db
...
Path: app/src/main/java/com/example/wastereborn/api/ApiService.java
 1	package com.example.wastereborn.api;
 2	
 3	import com.example.wastereborn.model.LoginRequest;
 4	import com.example.wastereborn.model.SignupRequest;
 5	import com.example.wastereborn.model.JwtResponse;
 6	import com.example.wastereborn.model.ApiResponse;
 7	import com.example.wastereborn.model.ProductResponse;
 8	
 9	import java.util.List;
 10	
 11	import retrofit2.Call;
 12	import retrofit2.http.*;
 13	
 14	public interface ApiService {
 15	 
 16	 // Authentication endpoints
 17	 @POST("auth/login")
 18	 Call<JwtResponse> login(@Body LoginRequest loginRequest);
 19	 
 20	 @POST("auth/signup")
 21	 Call<JwtResponse> signup(@Body SignupRequest signupRequest);
 22	 
 23	 @GET("auth/validate")
 24	 Call<JwtResponse> validateToken(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 25	 
 26	 // Product endpoints
 27	 @GET("products/public/all")
 28	 Call<List<ProductResponse>> getAllProducts();
 29	 
 30	 @GET("products/public/categories")
 31	 Call<List<String>> getCategories();
 32	 
 33	 @GET("products/public/category/{category}")
 34	 Call<List<ProductResponse>> getProductsByCategory(@Path("category") String category);
 35	 
 36	 @GET("products/public/search")
 37	 Call<List<ProductResponse>> searchProducts(@Query("keyword") String keyword);
 38	 
 39	 @GET("products/public/{id}")
 40	 Call<ProductResponse> getProductById(@Path("id") Long id);
 41	 
 42	 @GET("products/points-redeemable")
 43	 Call<List<ProductResponse>> getPointsRedeemableProducts(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 44	 
 45	 // User endpoints
 46	 @GET("users/profile")
 47	 Call<JwtResponse> getUserProfile(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 48	 
 49	 @PUT("users/profile")
 50	 Call<JwtResponse> updateUserProfile(@Header("Authorization") String token, @Body SignupRequest updateRequest);
 51	 
 52	 // Pickup endpoints
 53	 @POST("pickups")
 54	 Call<ApiResponse> createPickupRequest(@Header("Authorization") String token, @Body Object pickupRequest);
 55	 
 56	 @GET("pickups/user")
 57	 Call<List<Object>> getUserPickups(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 58	 
 59	 @GET("pickups/{id}")
 60	 Call<Object> getPickupById(@Header("Authorization") String token, @Path("id") Long id);
 61	 
 62	 // Order endpoints
 63	 @POST("orders")
 64	 Call<ApiResponse> createOrder(@Header("Authorization") String token, @Body Object orderRequest);
 65	 
 66	 @GET("orders/user")
 67	 Call<List<Object>> getUserOrders(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 68	 
 69	 @GET("orders/{id}")
 70	 Call<Object> getOrderById(@Header("Authorization") String token, @Path("id") Long id);
 71	 
 72	 // Admin endpoints
 73	 @GET("admin/users")
 74	 Call<List<JwtResponse>> getAllUsers(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 75	 
 76	 @GET("admin/orders")
 77	 Call<List<Object>> getAllOrders(@Header("Authorization") String token);
 78	 
 79	 @GET("admin/pickups")
 80	 Call<List<Object>> getAllPickups(@Header("Authorization") String token);

 49	 public JwtResponse getUserSession() {
 50	 if (!isLoggedIn()) {
 51	 return null;
 52	 }
 53	 
 54	 JwtResponse user = new JwtResponse();
 55	 user.setToken(pref.getString(KEY_TOKEN, null));
 56	 user.setId(pref.getLong(KEY_USER_ID, 0));
 57	 user.setEmail(pref.getString(KEY_EMAIL, null));
 58	 user.setFirstName(pref.getString(KEY_FIRST_NAME, null));
 59	 user.setLastName(pref.getString(KEY_LAST_NAME, null));
 60	 user.setPhoneNumber(pref.getString(KEY_PHONE, null));
 61	 user.setRole(pref.getString(KEY_ROLE, null));
 62	 user.setPointsBalance(pref.getInt(KEY_POINTS, 0));
 63	 user.setTotalOrders(pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, 0));
 64	 user.setTotalPickups(pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, 0));
 65	 user.setRecyclingPercentage((double) pref.getFloat(KEY_RECYCLING_PERCENTAGE, 0.0f));
 66	 
 67	 return user;
 68	 }
 69	 
 70	 public String getToken() {
 71	 return pref.getString(KEY_TOKEN, null);
 72	 }
 73	 
 74	 public String getAuthHeader() {
 75	 String token = getToken();
 76	 return token != null ? "Bearer " + token : null;
 77	 }
 78	 
 79	 public boolean isLoggedIn() {
 80	 return pref.getBoolean(KEY_IS_LOGGED_IN, false);
 81	 }
 82	 
 83	 public boolean isAdmin() {
 84	 return "ADMIN".equals(pref.getString(KEY_ROLE, "USER"));
 85	 }

 87	 public void updateUserStats(int points, int orders, int pickups, double recyclingPercentage) {
 88	 editor.putInt(KEY_POINTS, points);
 89	 editor.putInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, orders);
 90	 editor.putInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, pickups);
 91	 editor.putFloat(KEY_RECYCLING_PERCENTAGE, (float) recyclingPercentage);
 92	 editor.apply();
 93	 }
 94	 
 95	 public void logout() {
 96	 editor.clear();
 97	 editor.apply();
 98	 }

 51	 @Bean
 52	 public SecurityFilterChain filterChain(HttpSecurity http, DaoAuthenticationProvider authenticationProvider) throws Exception {
 53	 http.cors().and().csrf().disable()
 54	 .sessionManagement().sessionCreationPolicy(SessionCreationPolicy.STATELESS)
 55	 .and()
 56	 .authorizeHttpRequests(authz -> authz
 57	 .requestMatchers("/auth/**").permitAll()
 58	 .requestMatchers("/products/public/**").permitAll()
 59	 .requestMatchers("/admin/**").hasRole("ADMIN")
 60	 .anyRequest().authenticated()
 61	 );
 62	
 63	 http.authenticationProvider(authenticationProvider);
 64	 http.addFilterBefore(jwtAuthenticationFilter, UsernamePasswordAuthenticationFilter.class);
 65	
 66	 return http.build();
 67	 }

 69	 @Bean
 70	 public CorsConfigurationSource corsConfigurationSource() {
 71	 CorsConfiguration configuration = new CorsConfiguration();
 72	 configuration.setAllowedOriginPatterns(Arrays.asList("*"));
 73	 configuration.setAllowedMethods(Arrays.asList("GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", "OPTIONS"));
 74	 configuration.setAllowedHeaders(Arrays.asList("*"));
 75	 configuration.setAllowCredentials(true);
 76	 
 77	 UrlBasedCorsConfigurationSource source = new UrlBasedCorsConfigurationSource();
 78	 source.registerCorsConfiguration("/**", configuration);
 79	 return source;
 80	 }

 28	
 29	 @Override
 30	 protected void doFilterInternal(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response, FilterChain filterChain)
 31	 throws ServletException, IOException {
 32	
 33	 String token = getTokenFromRequest(request);
 34	
 35	 if (token != null && tokenProvider.validateToken(token)) {
 36	 String email = tokenProvider.getEmailFromToken(token);
 37	
 38	 UserDetails userDetails = userService.loadUserByUsername(email);
 39	 UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken authentication = 
 40	 new UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken(userDetails, null, userDetails.getAuthorities());
 41	 authentication.setDetails(new WebAuthenticationDetailsSource().buildDetails(request));
 42	
 43	 SecurityContextHolder.getContext().setAuthentication(authentication);
 44	 }
 45	
 46	 filterChain.doFilter(request, response);
 47	 }

 12	
 13	@Component
 14	public class JwtTokenProvider {
 15	
 16	 @Value("${spring.security.jwt.secret-key}")
 17	 private String jwtSecret;
 18	
 19	 @Value("${spring.security.jwt.expiration}")
 20	 private int jwtExpirationInMs;
 21	
 22	 private SecretKey getSigningKey() {
 23	 return Keys.hmacShaKeyFor(jwtSecret.getBytes());
 24	 }
 25	
 26	 public String generateToken(Authentication authentication) {
 27	 UserDetails userPrincipal = (UserDetails) authentication.getPrincipal();
 28	
 29	 Date expiryDate = new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() + jwtExpirationInMs);
 30	
 31	 return Jwts.builder()
 32	 .setSubject(userPrincipal.getUsername())
 33	 .setIssuedAt(new Date())
 34	 .setExpiration(expiryDate)
 35	 .signWith(getSigningKey(), SignatureAlgorithm.HS512)
 36	 .compact();
 37	 }

 3	import com.wastereborn.dto.JwtResponse;
 4	import com.wastereborn.dto.LoginRequest;
 5	import com.wastereborn.dto.SignupRequest;
 6	import com.wastereborn.model.User;
 7	import com.wastereborn.security.JwtTokenProvider;
 8	import com.wastereborn.service.UserService;
 9	import jakarta.validation.Valid;
 10	import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
 11	import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity;
 12	import org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationManager;
 13	import org.springframework.security.authentication.UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken;
 14	import org.springframework.security.core.Authentication;
 15	import org.springframework.security.core.context.SecurityContextHolder;
 16	import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
 17	
 18	@RestController
 19	@RequestMapping("/auth")
 20	@CrossOrigin(origins = "*", maxAge = 3600)
 21	public class AuthController {
 22	
 23	 @Autowired
 24	 private AuthenticationManager authenticationManager;
 25	
 26	 @Autowired
 27	 private UserService userService;
 28	
 29	 @Autowired
 30	 private JwtTokenProvider tokenProvider;
 31	
 32	 @PostMapping("/login")
 33	 public ResponseEntity<?> authenticateUser(@Valid @RequestBody LoginRequest loginRequest) {
 34	 try {
 35	 Authentication authentication = authenticationManager.authenticate(
 36	 new UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken(
 37	 loginRequest.getEmail(),
 38	 loginRequest.getPassword()
 39	 )
 40	 );
 41	
 42	 SecurityContextHolder.getContext().setAuthentication(authentication);
 43	 String jwt = tokenProvider.generateToken(authentication);
 44	
 45	 User user = (User) authentication.getPrincipal();
 46	 
 47	 return ResponseEntity.ok(new JwtResponse(jwt, user));
 48	 } catch (Exception e) {
 49	 return ResponseEntity.badRequest()
 50	 .body(new MessageResponse("Error: Invalid email or password!"));
 51	 }
 52	 }
...
 81	
 82	 @GetMapping("/validate")
 83	 public ResponseEntity<?> validateToken(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token) {
 84	 try {
 85	 if (token.startsWith("Bearer ")) {
 86	 token = token.substring(7);
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 if (tokenProvider.validateToken(token)) {
 90	 String email = tokenProvider.getEmailFromToken(token);
 91	 User user = userService.findByEmail(email)
 92	 .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("User not found"));
 93	 
 94	 return ResponseEntity.ok(new JwtResponse(token, user));
 95	 } else {
 96	 return ResponseEntity.badRequest()
 97	 .body(new MessageResponse("Error: Invalid token!"));
 98	 }
 99	 } catch (Exception e) {
 100	 return ResponseEntity.badRequest()
 101	 .body(new MessageResponse("Error: " + e.getMessage()));
 102	 }
 103	 }

 107	 @PutMapping("/users/{id}/role")
 108	 public ResponseEntity<User> updateUserRole(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestParam String role) {
 109	 try {
 110	 User.Role userRole = User.Role.valueOf(role.toUpperCase());
 111	 User user = userService.findById(id)
 112	 .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("User not found"));
 113	 
 114	 user.setRole(userRole);
 115	 User updatedUser = userService.updateUser(user);
 116	 return ResponseEntity.ok(updatedUser);
 117	 } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
 118	 return ResponseEntity.badRequest().build();
 119	 } catch (RuntimeException e) {
 120	 return ResponseEntity.notFound().build();
 121	 }
 122	 }

 111	
 112	 public void updateUserStats(Long userId, boolean isOrder, boolean isPickup) {
 113	 User user = userRepository.findById(userId)
 114	 .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("User not found"));
 115	 
 116	 if (isOrder) {
 117	 user.setTotalOrders(user.getTotalOrders() + 1);
 118	 }
 119	 
 120	 if (isPickup) {
 121	 user.setTotalPickups(user.getTotalPickups() + 1);
 122	 // Calculate recycling percentage (this is a simple calculation, you can make it more sophisticated)
 123	 double percentage = (user.getTotalPickups() * 10.0); // Each pickup contributes 10% (max 100%)
 124	 user.setRecyclingPercentage(Math.min(percentage, 100.0));
 125	 }
 126	 
 127	 userRepository.save(user);
 128	 }
 129	}

 89	 editor.putInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, orders);
 90	 editor.putInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, pickups);
 91	 editor.putFloat(KEY_RECYCLING_PERCENTAGE, (float) recyclingPercentage);
 92	 editor.apply();
 93	 }

 95	 public void logout() {
 96	 editor.clear();

 79	
 80	### Admin Analytics
 81	- **User Management** - Total users, active users, top recyclers
 82	- **Revenue Tracking** - Total, monthly, weekly, daily revenue
 83	- **Order Analytics** - Pending, completed, cancelled orders
 84	- **Pickup Management** - Scheduled, completed, pending pickups
 85	
 86	## Technical Architecture
 87	
 88	### Frontend (Android)
 89	```
 90	├── Activities (Main, Auth, Dashboard, Welcome)
 91	├── Fragments (Home, Marketplace, Cart, Pickup, Rewards, etc.)
 92	├── API Layer (Retrofit, ApiClient, ApiService)
 93	├── Models (User, Product, Order, etc.)
 94	├── Utils (SessionManager, CartManager)
 95	└── Resources (Layouts, Drawables, Strings)
 96	```

 40	 public ResponseEntity<Map<String, Object>> getDashboardStats() {
 41	 Map<String, Object> stats = new HashMap<>();
 42	 
 43	 // User statistics
 44	 List<User> allUsers = userService.getAllUsers();
 45	 List<User> regularUsers = userService.getUsersByRole(User.Role.USER);
 46	 List<User> adminUsers = userService.getUsersByRole(User.Role.ADMIN);
 47	 
 48	 stats.put("totalUsers", allUsers.size());
 49	 stats.put("regularUsers", regularUsers.size());
 50	 stats.put("adminUsers", adminUsers.size());
 51	 
 52	 // Order statistics
 53	 List<Order> allOrders = orderRepository.findAll();

 55	 List<Order> completedOrders = orderRepository.findByStatus(Order.OrderStatus.DELIVERED);

 69	 
 70	 // Product statistics
 71	 List<Product> allProducts = productRepository.findAll();
 72	 List<Product> availableProducts = productRepository.findByIsAvailable(true);
 73	 List<Product> pointsProducts = productRepository.findByIsPointsRedeemable(true);
 74	 
 75	 stats.put("totalProducts", allProducts.size());
 76	 stats.put("availableProducts", availableProducts.size());
 77	 stats.put("pointsProducts", pointsProducts.size());
 78	 
 79	 // Revenue statistics
 80	 Double totalRevenue = orderRepository.getTotalRevenue();
 81	 stats.put("totalRevenue", totalRevenue != null ? totalRevenue : 0.0);
 82	 
 83	 // Recent activity
 84	 LocalDateTime weekAgo = LocalDateTime.now().minusWeeks(1);
 85	 Double weeklyRevenue = orderRepository.getRevenueByDateRange(weekAgo, LocalDateTime.now());
 86	 stats.put("weeklyRevenue", weeklyRevenue != null ? weeklyRevenue : 0.0);
 87	 
 88	 List<Order> recentOrders = orderRepository.findByCreatedAtBetween(weekAgo, LocalDateTime.now());
 89	 stats.put("weeklyOrders", recentOrders.size());
 90	 
 91	 return ResponseEntity.ok(stats);
 92	 }

 49	 public JwtResponse getUserSession() {
 50	 if (!isLoggedIn()) {
 51	 return null;
 52	 }
 53	 
 54	 JwtResponse user = new JwtResponse();
 55	 user.setToken(pref.getString(KEY_TOKEN, null));
 56	 user.setId(pref.getLong(KEY_USER_ID, 0));
 57	 user.setEmail(pref.getString(KEY_EMAIL, null));
 58	 user.setFirstName(pref.getString(KEY_FIRST_NAME, null));
 59	 user.setLastName(pref.getString(KEY_LAST_NAME, null));
 60	 user.setPhoneNumber(pref.getString(KEY_PHONE, null));
 61	 user.setRole(pref.getString(KEY_ROLE, null));
 62	 user.setPointsBalance(pref.getInt(KEY_POINTS, 0));
 63	 user.setTotalOrders(pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, 0));
 64	 user.setTotalPickups(pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, 0));
 65	 user.setRecyclingPercentage((double) pref.getFloat(KEY_RECYCLING_PERCENTAGE, 0.0f));
 66	 
 67	 return user;
 68	 }
 69	 
 70	 public String getToken() {
 71	 return pref.getString(KEY_TOKEN, null);
 72	 }
 73	 
 74	 public String getAuthHeader() {
 75	 String token = getToken();
 76	 return token != null ? "Bearer " + token : null;
 77	 }
 78	 
 79	 public boolean isLoggedIn() {
 80	 return pref.getBoolean(KEY_IS_LOGGED_IN, false);
 81	 }
 82	 
 83	 public boolean isAdmin() {
 84	 return "ADMIN".equals(pref.getString(KEY_ROLE, "USER"));
 85	 }
 86	 
 87	 public void updateUserStats(int points, int orders, int pickups, double recyclingPercentage) {
 88	 editor.putInt(KEY_POINTS, points);
 89	 editor.putInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, orders);
 90	 editor.putInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, pickups);
 91	 editor.putFloat(KEY_RECYCLING_PERCENTAGE, (float) recyclingPercentage);
 92	 editor.apply();
 93	 }
 94	 
 95	 public void logout() {
 96	 editor.clear();
 97	 editor.apply();
 98	 }
 99	 
 100	 public String getUserName() {
 101	 String firstName = pref.getString(KEY_FIRST_NAME, "");
 102	 String lastName = pref.getString(KEY_LAST_NAME, "");
 103	 return (firstName + " " + lastName).trim();
 104	 }
 105	 
 106	 public String getUserInitial() {
 107	 String firstName = pref.getString(KEY_FIRST_NAME, "");
 108	 return firstName.isEmpty() ? "U" : firstName.substring(0, 1).toUpperCase();
 109	 }
 110	 
 111	 public int getPointsBalance() {
 112	 return pref.getInt(KEY_POINTS, 0);
 113	 }
 114	 
 115	 public int getTotalOrders() {
 116	 return pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_ORDERS, 0);
 117	 }
 118	 
 119	 public int getTotalPickups() {
 120	 return pref.getInt(KEY_TOTAL_PICKUPS, 0);
 121	 }

 97	
 98	### Backend (Spring Boot)
 99	```
 100	├── Controllers (Auth, Product, Pickup, Admin, etc.)
 101	├── Services (User, Product, Pickup, etc.)
 102	├── Models/Entities (User, Product, Order, PickupRequest)
 103	├── Repositories (JPA repositories)
 104	├── Security (JWT, Authentication filters)
 105	└── Configuration (Database, Security, CORS)
 106	```
 107	
 108	## Getting Started
 109	
 110	### Quick Setup
 111	1. **Clone Repository** - `git clone <repo-url>`
 112	2. **Setup Database** - Run PostgreSQL and create database
 113	3. **Start Backend** - `./run-backend.sh` or manual Maven setup
 114	4. **Open Android Studio** - Import project and run on device/emulator
 115	
 116	### Default Accounts
 117	- **Admin**: admin@wastereborn.com / password
 118	- **User**: john@example.com / password
 119	
 120	## Future Enhancements

 148	- Points reward system
 149	- Order tracking
 150	- Admin panel
 151	
 152	### Phase 3 (Planned)
 153	- Mobile money integration
 154	- Push notifications

 156	- Advanced analytics
 157	- Review system

Path: PROJECT_SUMMARY.md
...
 51	
 52	### ️ Database Schema
 53	- **Users** - User accounts with roles and statistics
 54	- **Products** - Recycled products catalog with categories
 55	- **Orders & Order Items** - Complete order management
 56	- **Pickup Requests** - Waste pickup scheduling and tracking
 57	- **Points System** - Reward tracking and redemption
 58	
 59	## Design & User Experience
 60	
 61	### Color Scheme
 62	- **Primary Green** (#4CAF50, #2E7D32) - Logo, main buttons, success states
 63	- **Sky Blue** (#87CEEB) - Accent highlights and secondary actions
 64	- **Clean Layout** - Black text on white background for readability
...
 97	
 98	### Backend (Spring Boot)
 99	```
 100	├── Controllers (Auth, Product, Pickup, Admin, etc.)
 101	├── Services (User, Product, Pickup, etc.)
 102	├── Models/Entities (User, Product, Order, PickupRequest)
 103	├── Repositories (JPA repositories)
 104	├── Security (JWT, Authentication filters)
 105	└── Configuration (Database, Security, CORS)
 106	```
 107	
 108	## Getting Started
 109	
 110	### Quick Setup
 111	1. **Clone Repository** - `git clone <repo-url>`
 112	2. **Setup Database** - Run PostgreSQL and create database
 113	3. **Start Backend** - `./run-backend.sh` or manual Maven setup
 114	4. **Open Android Studio** - Import project and run on device/emulator
 115	
 116	### Default Accounts
 117	- **Admin**: admin@wastereborn.com / password
 118	- **User**: john@example.com / password
 119	
 120	## Future Enhancements

 52

 54	 public void setProduct(Product product) { this.product = product; }
 55

 57	 public void setQuantity(Integer quantity) { this.quantity = quantity; }
 58

 60	 public void setUnitPrice(Double unitPrice) { this.unitPrice = unitPrice; }
 61	 
 62	 public Integer getPointsUsed() { return pointsUsed; }

 64	 
 65	 public Double getTotalPrice() {

 67	 }

 6	import java.time.LocalDateTime;

 8	@Entity
 9	@Table(name = "pickup_requests")
 10	public class PickupRequest {

 12	 @Id
 13	 @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
 14	 private Long id;
 15	 
 16	 @ManyToOne(fetch = FetchType.LAZY)
 17	 @JoinColumn(name = "user_id", nullable = false)
 18	 private User user;

 22

 24	 private String pickupStreet;
 25	 
 26	 @Column(name = "pickup_city")
 27	 private String pickupCity;
 28	 
 29	 @Column(name = "waste_type")
 30	 private String wasteType;
 31	 
 32	 @Column(name = "estimated_weight")
 33	 private Double estimatedWeight;
 34	 
 35	 @Column(name = "special_instructions", columnDefinition = "TEXT")
 36	 private String specialInstructions;
 37	 
 38	 @Column(name = "preferred_pickup_date")
 39	 private LocalDateTime preferredPickupDate;
 40	 
 41	 @Column(name = "scheduled_pickup_date")
 42	 private LocalDateTime scheduledPickupDate;
 43	 
 44	 @Column(name = "actual_pickup_date")
 45	 private LocalDateTime actualPickupDate;
 46	 
 47	 @Enumerated(EnumType.STRING)
 48	 @Column(name = "status")
 49	 private PickupStatus status = PickupStatus.PENDING;
 50	 
 51	 @Column(name = "points_awarded")
 52	 private Integer pointsAwarded = 0;
 53	 
 54	 @Column(name = "pickup_notes", columnDefinition = "TEXT")
 55	 private String pickupNotes;
 56	 
 57	 @ManyToOne(fetch = FetchType.LAZY)
 58	 @JoinColumn(name = "assigned_to")
 59	 private User assignedTo;
 60	 
 61	 @Column(name = "created_at")
 62	 private LocalDateTime createdAt = LocalDateTime.now();
 63	 
 64	 @Column(name = "updated_at")
 65	 private LocalDateTime updatedAt = LocalDateTime.now();
 66	 
 67	 // Constructors
 68	 public PickupRequest() {}
 69	 
 70	 public PickupRequest(User user, String pickupAddress, String wasteType, LocalDateTime preferredPickupDate) {
 71	 this.user = user;
 72	 this.pickupAddress = pickupAddress;
 73	 this.wasteType = wasteType;
 74	 this.preferredPickupDate = preferredPickupDate;

 79	
 80	### Admin Analytics
 81	- **User Management** - Total users, active users, top recyclers
 82	- **Revenue Tracking** - Total, monthly, weekly, daily revenue
 83	- **Order Analytics** - Pending, completed, cancelled orders
 84	- **Pickup Management** - Scheduled, completed, pending pickups

 86	## Technical Architecture
 87	
 88	### Frontend (Android)
 89	```
 90	├── Activities (Main, Auth, Dashboard, Welcome)
 91	├── Fragments (Home, Marketplace, Cart, Pickup, Rewards, etc.)
 92	├── API Layer (Retrofit, ApiClient, ApiService)
 93	├── Models (User, Product, Order, etc.)
 94	├── Utils (SessionManager, CartManager)
 95	└── Resources (Layouts, Drawables, Strings)
 96	```

 6	
 7	### User Features
 8	- **User Authentication** - Secure login and registration
 9	- ️ **Waste Pickup Booking** - Schedule waste collection based on street routes
 10	- **Recycled Products Marketplace** - Browse and purchase eco-friendly products
 11	- **Points Reward System** - Earn 5 points per successful pickup
 12	- **Order Tracking** - Track marketplace orders and pickup requests
 13	- **Personal Dashboard** - View recycling stats and order history
 14	- **Search & Filter** - Find products by category or keywords
 15	- **Chat Bot** - Get help and support
 16	- **Mobile Money Integration** - Pay using Orange Money/Mobile Money
 17	- **Progress Tracking** - Monitor recycling percentage and achievements
...

 36	### Android App
 37	- **Java** - Programming language
 38	- **Retrofit 2** - HTTP client
 39	- **Material Design** - UI components
 40	- **Glide** - Image loading
 41	- **SharedPreferences** - Local storage
 42

 46	- **Black on White** - Text and background

 50	### Prerequisites

 53	- Android Studio
 54	- Maven 3.6 or higher

 59	 ```bash
 60	 git clone <repository-url>
 61	 cd WasteReborn
 62	 ```

Path: app/src/main/java/com/example/wastereborn/fragments/HomeFragment.java
 1	package com.example.wastereborn.fragments;
 2	
 3	
 4	import android.os.Bundle;
 5	import android.os.Handler;
 6	import android.view.LayoutInflater;
 7	import android.view.View;
 8	import android.view.ViewGroup;
 9	import android.widget.TextView;
 10	
 11	import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
 12	import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
 13	import androidx.cardview.widget.CardView;
 14	import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
 15	
 16	import com.example.wastereborn.R;
 17	import com.example.wastereborn.utils.SessionManager;
 18	
 19	public class HomeFragment extends Fragment {
 20	
 21	 private TextView greetingText, userInitial, percentageRecycled, totalOrders;
 22	 private CardView cardOrderPickup, cardVisitStore;
 23	 private SessionManager sessionManager;
 24	
 25	 @Nullable
 26	 @Override
 27	 public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater,
 28	 @Nullable ViewGroup container,
 29	 @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
 30	
 31	 View view = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_home, container, false);
 32	
 33	 // Initialize session manager
 34	 sessionManager = new SessionManager(requireContext());
 35	
 36	 // Initialize views
 37	 greetingText = view.findViewById(R.id.greeting_text);
 38	 userInitial = view.findViewById(R.id.user_initial);
 39	 percentageRecycled = view.findViewById(R.id.percent_recycled);
 40	 totalOrders = view.findViewById(R.id.total_orders);
 41	 cardOrderPickup = view.findViewById(R.id.card_order_pickup);
 42	 cardVisitStore = view.findViewById(R.id.card_visit_store);
 43	
 44	 // Set greeting timeout (hide after 20 seconds)
 45	 new Handler().postDelayed(() -> greetingText.setVisibility(View.GONE), 20000);
 46	
 47	 // Load real user data from session
 48	 loadUserData();
 49	
 50	 // Set card click actions
 51	 cardOrderPickup.setOnClickListener(v -> {
 52	 // Navigate to PickupFragment
 53	 getParentFragmentManager().beginTransaction()
 54	 .replace(R.id.fragment_container, new PickupFragment())
 55	 .addToBackStack(null)
 56	 .commit();
 57	 });
 58	
 59	 cardVisitStore.setOnClickListener(v -> {
 60	 // Navigate to MarketPlaceFragment
 61	 getParentFragmentManager().beginTransaction()
 62	 .replace(R.id.fragment_container, new MarketPlaceFragment())
 63	 .addToBackStack(null)
 64	 .commit();
 65	 });
 66	
 67	 return view;
 68	 }
 69	
 70	 private void loadUserData() {
 71	 if (sessionManager.isLoggedIn()) {
 72	 // Set user initial
 73	 userInitial.setText(sessionManager.getUserInitial());
 74	
 75	 // Set user stats from session
 76	 double recyclingPercentage = sessionManager.getRecyclingPercentage();
 77	 int totalOrdersCount = sessionManager.getTotalOrders();
 78	
 79	 percentageRecycled.setText((int)recyclingPercentage + "% Recycled");
 80	 totalOrders.setText(totalOrdersCount + " Orders");
 81	
 82	 // Set greeting with user name
 83	 String greeting = "Hello, " + sessionManager.getUserName().split(" ")[0] + "!";
 84	 greetingText.setText(greeting);
 85	 } else {
 86	 // Default values if not logged in
 87	 userInitial.setText("U");
 88	 percentageRecycled.setText("0% Recycled");
 89	 totalOrders.setText("0 Orders");
 90	 greetingText.setText("Welcome to WasteReborn!");
 91	 }
 92	 }
 93	}
